member.name: T:Telerik.WebControls.AjaxRequestEventArgs
member.summary: A class containing the AJAX event arguments during an AJAX request.

example.code:
'ASPX <Input Type="button" value="Button" onclick="window['<%= RadAjaxManager1.ClientID %>'].AjaxRequest();">
'Server Side Code Private Sub RadAjaxManager1_AjaxRequest(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal e As Telerik.WebControls.AjaxRequestEventArgs) 'Code Handler using AjaxRequestEventArgs.... End Sub

member.name: M:Telerik.WebControls.AjaxRequestEventArgs.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the AsyncRequestEventArgs class.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.AjaxRequestEventArgs.Argument
member.summary: Returns the name of the AJAX request event.

member.name: T:Telerik.WebControls.RadAjaxManager
member.summary: RadAjaxManager is one of the two main controls that come with the r.a.d.ajax suite. Using the AJAX Manager control on your page, you can ajaxify all controls that normally work with postbacks. AJAX Manager has a builder tool that allows you to set the AJAX relations in design-mode and absolutely codeless. Using a single AJAX Manager on the page you can create complex web applications like Microsoft Outlook Â® Web Access portal.

member.name: T:Telerik.WebControls.RadAjaxUtils.RadAJAXControl
member.summary: This control is intended for internal usage by other telerik controls.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadAjaxUtils.RadControl.Version
member.summary: Gets the component's current version.

member.name: M:Telerik.WebControls.RadAjaxUtils.RadAJAXControl.GetPageUrl
member.summary: This method is intended only for internal usage.

member.name: M:Telerik.WebControls.RadAjaxUtils.RadAJAXControl.Redirect(System.String)
member.summary: Redirects the page to another location.
member.remarks: This method is usually used in the AJAX event handler instead of Response.Redirect(). It provides the only way to redirect to a page which does not contain any AJAX control at all.

member.name: M:Telerik.WebControls.RadAjaxUtils.RadAJAXControl.FocusControl(System.Web.UI.Control)
member.summary: Sets focus to the specified web control after the AJAX Request is finished.

member.name: M:Telerik.WebControls.RadAjaxUtils.RadAJAXControl.FocusControl(System.String)
member.summary: Sets focus to the specified web control after the AJAX Request is finished.

member.name: M:Telerik.WebControls.RadAjaxUtils.RadAJAXControl.GetAjaxEventReference(System.String)
member.summary: Gets client side code which raises an AjaxRequest event in either AJAX Manager or AJAX Panel.

example.code: Private Sub Page_Load(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles Page.Load ' Create a generic AJAX Request When the button Is clicked. ' "return false" To prevent postbacks Button1.Attributes["onclick"] = RadAjaxPanel1.GetAjaxEventReference("argument...") & " return false;" ' Generic requests can be fired On both AJAX Manager And AJAX Panel Button1.Attributes["onclick"] = RadAjaxManager1.GetAjaxEventReference("argument...") & " return false;" End Sub

member.name: M:Telerik.WebControls.RadAjaxUtils.RadAJAXControl.GetAjaxRequestReference(System.String)
member.summary: Gets client side code which raises an AjaxRequest event in either AJAX Manager or AJAX Panel.

example.code: Private Sub Page_Load(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles Page.Load ' Create a generic AJAX Request When the button Is clicked. ' "return false" To prevent postbacks Button1.Attributes["onclick"] = RadAjaxPanel1.GetAjaxRequestReference("argument...") & " return false;" ' Generic requests can be fired On both AJAX Manager And AJAX Panel Button1.Attributes["onclick"] = RadAjaxManager1.GetAjaxRequestReference("argument...") & " return false;" End Sub

member.name: M:Telerik.WebControls.RadAjaxUtils.RadAJAXControl.Alert(System.String)
member.summary: Displays an alert message at client-side.

remarks.para: This is the easiest way to show a message, generated from the server, on the client in a message box.
Note: Special characteres are not escaped.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadAjaxUtils.RadAJAXControl.ResponseScripts
member.summary: Gets or sets a string collection of JavaScripts that will be executed on client-side when the response returns.
member.example:
The following example demonstrates a sample usage of the ResponseScripts property:
<form id="Form1" method="post" runat="server"> <script language="C#" runat="server"> private void RadAjaxManager1_AjaxRequest(object sender, System.EventArgs e) { RadAjaxManager1.ResponseScript.Add("alert('This can be any script!');"); } </script> <radA:RadAjaxManager id="RadAjaxManager1" DebugMode="False" onAjaxRequest="RadAjaxManager1_AjaxRequest" runat="server" ></radA:RadAjaxManager> </form>
<form id="Form1" method="post" runat="server"> <script language="VB" runat="server"> Private Sub RadAjaxManager1_AjaxRequest(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) RadAjaxManager.ResponseScript.Add("alert('This can be any script!');") End Sub 'RadAjaxManager1_AjaxRequest </script> <radA:RadAjaxManager id="RadAjaxManager1" DebugMode="False" onAjaxRequest="RadAjaxManager1_AjaxRequest" runat="server" ></radA:RadAjaxManager> </form>

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadAjaxUtils.RadAJAXControl.EnableAJAX
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the control will work in AJAX or Postback mode.
member.remarks: Set to false to force using postbacks instead of AJAX requests.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadAjaxUtils.RadAJAXControl.EnableOutsideScripts
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating if the outside scripts for the AJAX-enabled controls will be evaluated.
member.remarks: Outside scripts are scripts rendered from the code-behind and are usually not executed if they are rendered outside of the currently updated control(s).

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadAjaxUtils.RadAJAXControl.IsAsyncRequest
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the current request is an AJAX request initiated by the current control.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadAjaxUtils.RadAJAXControl.IsAjaxRequest
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the current request is an AJAX request initiated by the current control.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadAjaxUtils.RadAJAXControl.AjaxUrl
member.summary: Gets or sets a value containing the URL that will be used for AJAX request.
member.value: Returns a String containing the URL that will be used for AJAX request. The default value is the URL of the current page.
member.remarks: AJAX Panel and AJAX Manager automatically resolve the current page URL when forming the request. However if you want to achieve different scenario such as AJAX requests between two pages you can set the desired URL for the request using this property.
member.summary: Gets or sets a value the URL that the control will use for AJAX requests.

member.name: M:Telerik.WebControls.RadAjaxManager.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the RadAjaxManager class.
member.returns: Returns a reference to the newly instatiated RadAjaxManager object.

remarks.para: Use this constructor to create and initialize a new instance of the RadAjaxManager class.

member.name: M:Telerik.WebControls.RadAjaxManager.CreateChildControls
member.summary: Notifies server controls that use composition-based implementation to create any child controls they contain in preparation for posting back or rendering.

member.name: M:Telerik.WebControls.RadAjaxManager.GetClientEventsParamValue(System.String)
member.summary: Occurs when the Callback event is raised.

summary.para: This event is fired whenever the client-side function AjaxRequest(arguments) is called. Alternatively the event is fired with AjaxRequestWithTarget(eventTarget, eventArgument) when the eventTarget is the UniqueID of the AJAX Manager instance.
When the manager ajaxifies itself it will perform an AJAX request, otherwise it will postback to the server (this is the default behavior).

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadAjaxManager.ClientEvents

summary.para: Gets a reference to the AjaxClientEvents object which specifies the names of the JavaScript functions which are called at different stages of the AJAXrequest.
The following client events are available:

member.value: AjaxClientEvents object which specifies the names of the JavaScript functions.

summary.para: AjaxSettings provides a way to programmatically set or get the AjaxSettings collection associated with the instance of the RadAjaxManager. It is usually defined declaratively (as demonstrated below) or using the visual designer.

member.name: T:Telerik.WebControls.AjaxLoadingPanel
member.summary: This class represents a panel that will be used as a progress indicator during an AJAX request.
member.remarks: The AjaxLoadingPanel's contents will be displayed instead the updated controls, so that users are aware what controls will get updated. You can have the Loading Panel shown on a predefined location if you set its IsSticky property.

member.name: M:Telerik.WebControls.AjaxLoadingPanel.#ctor
member.summary: The default constructor for the AjaxLoadingPanel class.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.AjaxLoadingPanel.RadControlsDir
member.summary: Relative path to RadControls folder.

summary.para: The IsSticky property of the Loading Panel controls where the panel will appear during the AJAX request. If this property is set to true, the panel will appear where you have placed it on your webform. If this property is set to false, the Loading panel will appear on the place of the updated control(s).
By default this property is set to false.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.AjaxLoadingPanel.InitialDelayTime
member.summary: Gets or sets a value specifying the delay in milliseconds, after which the AjaxLoadingPanel will be shown. If the request returns before this time, the AjaxLoadingPanel will not be shown.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.AjaxLoadingPanel.MinDisplayTime
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the minimum time that the AjaxLoadingPanel will last. The control will not be updated before this period has passed even if the request returns. This will ensure more smoother interface for your page.

member.name: T:Telerik.WebControls.RadAjaxPanel
member.summary: AJAX Panel is used as a placeholder for other controls. Once placed in the panel, any ASP.NET control will start making AJAX requests instead of traditional postbacks.

member.name: M:Telerik.WebControls.RadAjaxPanel.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the AJAXPanel class.
member.returns: Returns a reference to the newly instatiated AJAXPanel object.

remarks.para: Use this constructor to create and initialize a new instance of the AJAXPanel class.

member.name: E:Telerik.WebControls.RadAjaxPanel.AjaxRequest
member.summary: This event is fired when RaisePostbackEvent of the AJAXPanel is fired.
member.remarks: e.RequestArgument is the eventArgument of the RaisePostbackEvent.

member.name: E:Telerik.WebControls.RadAjaxPanel.Command

summary.para: The Command event is raised when RaiseBuibble event is fired in the AJAXPanel control.

example.para:
<radA:RadAjaxPanel ID="AJAXPanel1" runat="server" OnCommand="AJAXPanel1_Command">
<asp:Button ID="Button1" CommandName="MyCommand" runat="server" Text="My Text" />
example.code: Private Sub AJAXPanel1_Command(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal e As System.Web.UI.WebControls.CommandEventArgs) If (e.CommandName = "MyCommand") Then ' your code goes here End If End Sub

member.remarks: This event is commonly used to handle button controls with a custom CommandName value.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadAjaxPanel.LoadingPanelID
member.summary: Gets or sets the ID of the AjaxLoadingPanel control that will be displayed over the control during AJAX requests. If you leave this blank (string.Empty) there will be no loading panel displayed.
member.value: The ID of the loading template. An empty string means that no panel will be displayed while loading data.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadAjaxPanel.Wrap
member.summary: This property specifies the layout of the AjaxPanel. When this is set to FALSE, the AjaxPanel contents will not be wrapped to a new line no matter how wide the control is.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadAjaxPanel.HorizontalAlign
member.summary: This property specifies the horizontal alignment of the RadAjaxPanel contents.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadAjaxPanel.BackImageUrl
member.summary: This property specifies the image that should be displayed as background in the AjaxPanel. If left blank, no background image is applied.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadAjaxPanel.ClientEvents
member.summary: Set of options for panel's client-events

member.name: T:Telerik.WebControls.RadAjaxTimer
member.summary: The RadAjaxTimer class is a simple postback control that raises a postback Tick event continuously with a specified Interval Property. In order to make the timer control perform AJAX requests, you need to ajaxify it with RadAjaxManager or by placing it in RadAjaxPanel.
member.example: If RadAjaxTimer is not ajaxified it will only perform postbacks.

member.name: M:Telerik.WebControls.RadAjaxTimer.Start
member.summary: Starts the instance of the timer.

member.name: M:Telerik.WebControls.RadAjaxTimer.Stop
member.summary: Stops the instance of the timer.

member.name: M:Telerik.WebControls.RadAjaxTimer.#ctor
member.summary: This is the default constructor for the RadAjaxTimer class.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadAjaxTimer.AutoStart
member.summary: This property determines wether the timer should begin ticking on the client after a server response (either AJAX or postback)

summary.para: This property specifies the interval in which the timer would raise the Tick Event event.
Default value is: 2000ms (2 seconds)

member.name: E:Telerik.WebControls.RadAjaxTimer.Tick
member.summary: This is the bread and butter event of the timer. It executes once during each Interval Property. You may use this event to rebind your controls or make other changes.

member.name: T:Telerik.WebControls.TickEventArgs
member.summary: Summary description for TickEventArgs.
